Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as ab0d439013c3a42a8221f8718124bcc897ac21ab
I don't see this case handled anymore in your code
Done
Why was this changed.  The previous type was more correct, and required less handling of special cases.
Seems already fixed.
Is there a networkd change here too?

yes here is networkd commit 
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-networkd/+/63033
Done
Not sure we need to wait for that, and at least the interface change is now linked.

In this loop there's 3 conditions that need handled on each entry of the array:
1. null
  Should delete the entry, or return an error if the entry doesn't exist.
2. empty object
  Should return an error if the entry doesn't exist, otherwise make no changes
3. Object populated with fields
  if we're past the end of existing gateways, create a new gateway.
  if we're not past the end of existing gateways, should update the gateway appropriately with whatever fields are present.



I would like to see those 3 conditions as top level branches, which is what they were before, and makes the logic a lot less confusing.  I could certainly see some cleanups warranted here (I think I saw a couple bugs in the review of the old code)

But having conditions like:

if (obj != nullptr && !obj->empty())

Are a bit confusing, and much harder to read the logic of.  FWIW, changing the types here to a std::variant helped quite a bit to make it clear it was in one of two conditions.  Lets not take a step backwards in complexity.

kept existing code as it for now.
hope we no longer need this change in this commit.
Will check and address this refactoring if needed in another commit
Not sure why you removed this? Oh well, doesn't help much
change removed.
you don't have this check or error any more..
code removed
FWIW, this return looks incorrect.  We should keep looping with continue here.
ok
Done
Same thing at the end of this branch, we should continue, rather than trying to parse the empty object
Done
Please check to see if this is in Redfish.md, and if it is, remove it.
ack

prefix property was not mentioned in Redfish.md
actually need to update "IPv6StaticDefaultGateways" in Redfish.md

This is changing behavior.  Previously we accepted a PrefixLength property;  Even if we don't use it in the final interface, we should accept it as a std::optional, like we did before so that implementations that worked before continue to work.
ok, that can be done, but it won't have any useful since backend does not consume this prefix value
yeah we can make this as std::optional and allow PrefixLength redfish property and if we allow PrefixLength redfish property then need to populate PrefixLength with default value

I'm fine if we completely ignore the parameter.  I'm not really sure what it would've done anyway, because this isn't a subnet, but commands that worked before should continue to work, so we need to keep it in the API.  Please also add a comment to that effect in the code.
To follow up on discord, this interface never worked, there's no reason to keep the old parameters.  CLosing this thread as resolved.

Nit, doesn't need done on this patch, but ideally we'd call these out with specific properties, so this would be

IPv6StaticDefaultGateways[]/Gateway
IPv6StaticDefaultGateways[]/ProtocolType

but that's a problem for another commit.  There's lots more in this that would need fixed.

ok I followed same existing format of IPv6StaticAddresses.
Sure will fix it next commit
Done
